content.description:
THE LOWER SHELF FEATURES ARE NOT PART OF THIS ROUTE-- if they are used the climb is far easier. 

  Start just to the left of the big crack that marks the left side of Pooh's roof (pooh's roof is over top of the jars and pans that are out there for kids to play with). Make a move to the obvious sloping feature at about waist hight. move left to the two crimps and then up and left to exit with a few big moves at the top.
content.protection: Pad or two and a spotter so you don't fall off the small ledge
content.location: Pooh's house on the overhanging feature left of the very steep roof.

content.description: A neat piece of rock with several problems on it at the end of the Winnie the Poo trail. Some highball stuff, some overhangs. All very dirty. Might be some TR availability with static lines or long slings for anchors.
